functions.tip-1: Cloud function is the core of the cloud code business logic, it can be used to implement various complex logic, also can use a variety of third-party libraries.
functions.tip-3: Cloud function request will also be counted, you can analyze cloud function running status. See the guide
functions.tip-2: Cloud function support add a method call to the white list, add, call this function when the request, will not be for security check.

version.tip-1: Cloud code is deployed to run on MaxLeap code, you can use it to realize the more complex, need to run the business logic in the cloud.At present mainly provide cloud function, timing tasks, hook for cloud data and other functions.
version.tip-3: Also support the gray cloud code release function, you can run at the same time not more than two versions of the code and request traffic distribution on different versions. See the guide
version.tip-2: Cloud code support a version of the code running in not more than three instances, instance memory size are free to choose, each instance will, on average, receives the request.

tip.instance-limit: A total of up to three instances
tip.whitelist: whitelist, the function in white list would not check header if contain X-LAS-AppId and X-LAS-APIKey.
tip.number: Each Version Up To Run Three Instances
tip.sure-undeploy-version: All instances will be stopped.Sure to unDeploy version:
tip.follow-control: Gray released according to the proportion of all request to corresponding version instance
tip.flowControlWarn: Warn:Your current version's application will be unable to service
tip.copy-from: If you've defines the background tasks on other versions, you can reuse them on to the latest version

schedule.tip-1: Cloud code support tasks regularly, it can effectively help you to complete some repetitive tasks.Including the periodic tasks and a one-off task.
schedule.tip-3: Timed tasks can be executed once, immediately forced its timing set running time is not conflict.
schedule.tip-2: Periodic task is refers to the task in accordance with the predefined time run repeatedly, can be enabled or stop at any time.One-time task is the task runs only once, according to the specified time to run, after the operation will not repeat.

guide-page.function:
No Cloud Functions yet!

Cloud function is the core of the cloud code logic component, is running on the MaxLeap code. You can use it to realize all kinds of complicated logic, also can use a variety of 3 rd Party Libs.

If you still don't know how to use cloud function,See the Guide

instances.tip-1: When cloud code is deployed, you can select the relevant computing resources to run, we call the instance.
instances.tip-3: You can also be convenient for each instance named alias operations.
instances.tip-2: You can choose the different instance types according to their own needs to deploy your code of cloud, currently running at the same time support the same version of cloud code in not more than three instance.

logs.tip-1: Cloud code provides logging, can take the initiative to record function, Hook or timing information task in the process of running.Cloud code deployment process, also will be the system down.
logs.tip-3: You can also view the log cloud code command line tools. See the guide
logs.tip-2: Cloud code log support different versions of view respectively.

iOS SDK

tips.newusers:
New Users

You can compare data analysis results of versions, channels, segments. Data can be grouped by day, week or month. Hourly data is currently only available within a 7-day period and data manipulation is not currently supported. When displaying new user numbers by week (or month), we use Monday of every week (or first day of every month) to represent that week (or month).

New User : A user who has started your application for the first time. A user is uniquely identified by device id.
tips.channels:
Channels

Providing varying trend analysis in channels of Top 10 total users, helping you understand user activities and promoting effects by channel to determine proper promotional strategies.

New User : A user who has started your application for the first time. A user is uniquely identified by device id.

Active User : A user who has started your app during a time period, regardless of whether it is a new user or an old user.

Session : The application start number is monitored by calling MobclickAgent.onResume() and MobclickAgent.onPause() in every 'Activity'. If a user enters the home page or other applications during his/her using of your application and comes back after certain time duration X (which can be determined by developers), then it counts as a new application start.

Session Length : The length of time in one session.

Retention Rate 1 Day Later : The proportion of users coming from this specific channel and using the application on the day right after their first use.
tips.frequency:
Frequency

Comparing daily sessions of versions, channels and segments in any given day.

Daily Session : The times of application start in a day by a user.
tips.screenflow-detail:
Screen Flow Detail

Page visiting details shows the visit times, visit duration and page redirections of that page. This helps you analyze the usage of that page among users.

Page : a page in Android or iOS system.

Visits : The total # of times users entered this page.

Visits Rate : The number of times all users entered this page divided by the number of times all users entered all pages.

Duration : The average amount of time users spends in this page.

% of Total Duration : The amount of time users spend in this page/the amount of time a user spends in the application.

Exit Rate : Rate of application termination from this specific page.

Exit Details : Rate of entering other pages from this page.
tips.arppu: Daily ARPPU: Daily Average Revenue Per Paying User ( Daily Revenue/DAPU )
tips.retention:
Retention

User retention is a measure of how long a given user remains an active user after becoming a new user. Retention rate is calculated by dividing the number of retained users by the the number of new users. For example, there were 200 new users in May, if 100 users relaunched the application in June among these 200 users, 80 users relaunched in July, 50 users relaunched in August; then the retention of new users a month later is 50%, two months later is 40%, three months later is 25%.
tips.sessions-detail:
Sessions Detail

% of Sessions : Sessions for the proportion of total sessions in the given time bucket.
tips.appversions-detail:
App Versions Detail

Total Users(%) : Portion of users of a version over all users at current time; if a user upgrades the app from an old version to a new version, the total users of original version will decrease and number of users of new version will increase.

New User : A user who has started your application for the first time. A user is uniquely identified by device id.

Updated User : User who upgrade his app version from other versions(Users are identified by unique phone ids).

Active User : A user who has started your app during a time period, regardless of whether it is a new user or an old user.

Session : The number of application start is determined by using MobclickAgent.onResume() and MobclickAgent.onPause() in every activity. During an active session, if a user leaves your application and initiates a different activity, such as entering into home page or starting a different application, and returns to your application after a certain amount of time determined by developers (default is 30 seconds), it counts as a new start. Time lapse during inactivity does not count as a new start.
tips.arpu: Daily ARPU: Daily Average Revenue Per User ( Daily Revenue/DAU )
tips.retention-tips: __rate__ of the devices that first installed the app on __date__ were active __time__.
tips.newusers-detail:
New Users Detail

New / Active : New users / active users.
tips.funnel:
Please choose events for each step, and name them respectively.
            Names of Funnels and Steps can include number, letters, underscore and Chinese characters. The maximum length is 20.
            Each funnel can have a maximum of 10 steps.
            Each app can have a maximum of 30 funnels.
            Data will be availiable one day after the creation of funnel(s).
tips.sessions:
Sessions

You can compare data analysis results of versions, channels, segments. Data can be grouped by day, week or month. Hourly data is currently only available within a 7-day period and data manipulation is not currently supported. When displaying new user numbers by week (or month), we use Monday of every week (or first day of every month) to represent that week (or month).

Session : The number of application start is determined by using MobclickAgent.onResume() and MobclickAgent.onPause() in every activity. During an active session, if a user leaves your application and initiates a different activity, such as entering into home page or starting a different application, and returns to your application after a certain amount of time determined by developers (default is 30 seconds), it counts as a new start. Time lapse during inactivity does not count as a new start.
tips.sessionlengthdaily:
Daily Session Length

Comparing session length of versions, channels and segments in any given day.

Daily Session Length : Duration of application starts in a given day by a user.
tips.paytrend:
Revenue：The total purchase count of users during a selected period. For example, if the time window show 1st to 7th and the grain of time dimension is daily then it refers to daily payment of 1st to 7th day.

Paying Users: The amount of paying users during a selected period ( including daily de-duplication )

Count: The number of times your users pay during a selected period.
tips.conversion-durations: Elapsed Time: The duration for being a paying user, which equals to first paying date minus first active date.
tips.activeusers-detail:
Active Users Detail

Percentage of Active Users : Active users for the proportion of total active users in the given time bucket.
tips.screenflow:
Screen Flow

Visit path describes the route that a user takes to navigate the pages within an application. The chart visually displays the visiting rate of every page. The data used for describing the visit path is selected by statistically significant samples.

The initial node default is the page users visited most frequently. The green path is the highest reached path and opens default.

Click the symbol at the top-right corner of each node to create a tree rooting with it.
tips.sessionlengthdistribution:
Session Length Distribution

Comparing session length of versions, channels and segments in any given day.

Session Length : The length of time in one session.
tips.appversions:
App Versions

Providing the variation trend of versions whose total users are in Top 10, helping you know the new users of each version, the upgrade status of new version, the most active versions recently, and so on.

Session : The number of application start is determined by using MobclickAgent.onResume() and MobclickAgent.onPause() in every activity. During an active session, if a user leaves your application and initiates a different activity, such as entering into home page or starting a different application, and returns to your application after a certain amount of time determined by developers (default is 30 seconds), it counts as a new start. Time lapse during inactivity does not count as a new start.

New User : A user who has started your application for the first time. A user is uniquely identified by device id.

Active User : A user who has started your app during a time period, regardless of whether it is a new user or an old user.
tips.activeusers:
Active Users

You can compare data analysis results of versions, channels, segments. Data can be grouped by day, week or month. Present day data manipulation is not currently supported.

Active User : A user who has started your app during a time period, regardless of whether it is a new user or an old user.

Weekly Active Users : Users who has a session with your application in a week,X-axis : Monday of each week.

Weekly Active Rate : Active users in a week / total users, X-axis : Monday of each week.

Monthly Active Users : Users who had a session with your application in a month, X-axis : First day of each month.

Monthly Active Rate : Active users in a month / total users, X-axis : First day of each month.
tips.new-payconversion:
First day pay rate: Users pay on the 1st day/New Users on the 1st day

First week pay rate: Users pay within 7 days/New users on the 1st day

First month pay rate: Users pay within 30 days/New users on the 1st day
tips.channels-detail:
Channels Detail

New User : A user who has started your application for the first time. A user is uniquely identified by device id.

Active User : A user who has started your app during a time period, regardless of whether it is a new user or an old user.

Total Users(%) : All users of this channel who had a session with your application till now. (# of users of this channel divide by # of total users).

tip.intro-2: With segment, you can analyze how groups of application users behave differently.
tip.intro-3: You can also perform marketing campaigns targeting to user segments.
tip.intro-1: A user segment is a group of application users who have the same behavior or criteria.
tip.intro-all:
What is User Segment?
    A user segment is a group of application users who have the same behavior or criteria.
    With segment, you can analyze how groups of application users behave differently.
    You can also perform marketing campaigns targeting to user segments.
    User segment can be created with the criteria: data range, usage, custom events, location, etc.
tip.intro-4: User segment can be created with the criteria: data range, usage, custom events, location, etc.

tip.delete-app: Delete App(Click this and we'll clean up all unused files in your account. We'll send you an email when it's done.)
tip.client-key:
Client Key

This key should be used in consumer clients, like the iOS or Android SDK. It adheres to object level permissions.
tip.application-id:
Application ID

This is the main identifier that uniquely specifies your application. This is paired with a key to provide your clients access to your application's data.
tip.verify-email:
Verify Email

Send a verification email to users upon signup. After they verify, the user's emailVerified field is set to true
tip.url:
URL

The link for downloading and installing your app.
tip.link-verify-error:
Verify Error

Upload a modified version of the template to your service and enter its address here. This page will be loaded whenever users mistype the reset password or verify email links.
tip.subject: Subject
tip.link-new-pw:
New Password

This page will be loaded when users click on a reset password link.
tip.reset_password_tpl:
Reset Password Template

The subject and body of the message sent to users with a link that will let the user choose a new password. The values %username%, %email%, %appname%, and %link% will be filled in with their appropriate values.
tip.app-offlineanalysis: MaxLeap provides developers with some compatible with SQL syntax offline data analysis capabilities. Offline data analysis of the data source is the daily backup data won't be any impact on the application of online data.
tip.master-key:
Master Key

This key is only allowed to access the REST API and does not adhere to object level permissions. This should be kept secret.
tip.email-template-link: the link the user must click to perform the requested action
tip.product-name:
Product Name

The user facing name of your app.
tip.twitter:
Twitter

Ensure that authentication is limited to people who have authorized your application for Twitter login by specifying your trusted consumer keys as a comma-separated list.
tip.email-template-appname: the display name of your app
tip.app-permission: Allows new classes to be created without the master key (e.g. from Android, iOS, REST, or JavaScript clients). Once your app's classes are finalized, you can disable access to ensure malicious users can't create new classes.
tip.link-change-pw:
Change Password

This page will be loaded when users successfully change their password.
tip.facebook:
FaceBook

Ensure that authentication is limited to people who have authorized your application for Facebook login and allow better use of access tokens across multiple devices by specifying the IDs and secrets of your trusted applications.
tip.custom-pages: These are the pages your users visit when resetting their password or verifying their email addresses. You can customize the look and feel of these pages by uploading a modified copy to your server and telling us their locations.
tip.release-product:
Release Product

When you're ready to launch your app, please enter your app store link here. This will help us track your app's traffic and allow us to properly scale your app's performance.
tip.icon:
Icon

We accept PNG and JPG, size bigger than 512 x 512 is recommended.
tip.link-verify-success:
Verify Success

This page will be loaded when users verify their email address.
tip.javascript-key:
Javascript Key

This key should be used when making requests from JavaScript running on a user's machine. It adheres to object-level permissions.
tip.rest-key:
Rest Key

This key should be used when making requests to the REST API. It also adheres to object level permissions.
tip.upload: We accept PNG and JPG, size bigger than 512 x 512 is recommended.
tip.email-template: Customize the e-mail sent to your users when they reset their password or when we verify their email address. The following variables will be automatically filled in with their appropriate values :
tip.allow-create:
Allow Permission

Allows new classes to be created without the master key (e.g. from Android, iOS, REST, or JavaScript clients). Once your app's classes are finalized, you can disable access to ensure malicious users can't create new classes.
tip.verify_email_tpl:
Verify Email Template

The subject and body of the message sent to users with a link that will verify their email address. The values %username%, %email%, %appname%, and %link% will be filled in with their appropriate values.
tip.enter-password: Please type your password to confirm.
tip.dotnet-key:
.Net Key

This key should be used when making requests from a Windows, Xamarin, or Unity application. It adheres to object-level permissions.

tips.api-key: The GCM API key is a secret key used to send pushes to Android devices. It is listed under the "Authentication" section of the Google API console.
tips.android-schema: A URL scheme lets you communicate with other apps through a protocol that you define.
tips.google-play: Shop Google Play on the web. https://play.google.com/store
tips.app-type: Choose your Application type:app/game. Once selected,you can not change it later.
tips.ios-schema: A URL scheme lets you communicate with other apps through a protocol that you define.
tips.sender-id: The GCM sender ID is an integer listed under "Project Number" in the Google API console.
tips.client-secret: The client secret obtained from the Developers Console.
tips.client-id: The client id obtained from the Developers Console.
tips.developer-secret: The developer secret is required to be passed in via receipt verification.
tips.refresh-token: A refresh token allows your application to obtain new access tokens.

tips.show-message: Click the left to see the message detail

title.getting-started: Your App __APPNAME__ has been successfully created

tip.click-create: Click button to add a row here.
tip.enter-appname: App name can only contain numbers, letters and underscore, and can only start with a letter

tag.address: Xuhui district of Shanghai yishan Road, 21, 888

tips.find-keys: You can also find your App Keys in App Info - Application Keys in the menu
tips.integrate-sdk: Now it's time to integrate MaxLeap SDK in your App

exeption.no-sectionId: Can not find SectionID, Please refresh and try again!

format.marketingschedule: start date should be earlier than end date
format.appname: this field must start with character, contain number, character and space only.
format.bigger: This field should not be smaller than the last one
format.username: Username cannot be less than 6 characters
format.numberGT0: This field should be Integer and more than  0
format.numberBT1To7AndBigger: This field should be between 1 to 7 and  bigger than the last one!
format.numberBT1To7: This field should be Integer and more than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 7
format.password: Password cannot be less than 8 characters
format.geo: the longitude must between -180.0 ~ 180.0 and the latitude must between -90.0 ~ 90.0
format.numberGTE1: This field should be Integer and more than or equal to 1
format.numberGTE0: This field should be Integer and more than or equal to 0
format.columnname: this field must start with character, contain number and character only

restrict.off-shelf: 下架时间应该晚于上架时间
restrict.expire-range: 有效期结束时间应该晚于开始时间

local.upload-size-limit: We support File which size under 100M
local.nameandemail: Customer Name & Customer Email must be set at the same time
local.lack-lang: The language you required is not supported in this FAQ!
local.empty-tag: You can not create an empty tag
local.subscription-empty-module: You must choose at least 1 module
local.subscription-empty-period: You must choose at least 1 period
local.least-event: You must add at least 1 event

guide-page.notopen:
You have not yet for the current App CloudData offline analysis to start!

       MaxLeap provides developers with some compatible with SQL syntax cloud data offline analysis function. Off-line analysis of the data source is the daily backup data won't be any impact on the application of online data.

       To enable the CloudData offline analysis, you need to check in the console Application Settings to enable cloud data offline analysis, when you enable MaxLeap will query data for your App, the process need not more than 1 hour, when the data preparation is complete, you can use.

iOS Guide Android Guide

errorcode.SQL_DATABASE_ENSURE_ERROR: Failure to prepare a data file, the data can not be loaded

tips.trialend:
Your probation peried is over,
if want to continue the trail,please upgrade version for the enterprise
tips.queryresult: LeapQL  completed in 1 minutes the result is called a real-time results, whereas called offline results. Real-time results show a maximum of 1000 records, you can export all the query results; LeapQL hasn't been executed more than 1 minute, you don't have to always waiting online,  after LeapQL completed,  MaxLeap will sent the results to your registered email, you can download the query results in an E-mail. At this point you can continue to perform other LeapQL.
tips.trailtime-left: Trial time is still 29 day(s) left, Upgrade
tips.updating-package: Is under approval,will be able to continue to use after finish.
tips.prepare-data: Your data is being prepared, please wait a minute...
tips.sql-grammar: LeapQL industry general is a kind of SQL ,query syntax and grammar in detail, and other relevant details, please refer to See the guide
tips.recentquery: Recent query table only show your recent 30 successful execution LeapQL query history.
tips.cancel: LeapQL have submitted successfully, your query requires more than 1 minute to complete, the final query results will be sent to your registered email to email, you can download the query results in the mail.

webhook.sure-to-mode-test: Sure you want to switch to Test mode?
webhook.sure-to-mode-live: Sure you want to switch to Live mode?

tips.webhook-4: Webhooks support events include Pay Success、 Refunded Success. See the guide
tips.webhook-1: In order to facilitate customer transactions are handled by the customer or third party system information, MaxPay support Webhooks function, can according to customer's requirements to specific events result delivery to the address specified so that the customer do further processing.
tips.webhook-3: Webhooks notification contains a signature field, using the signature verification Webhooks the legitimacy of the notice.
tips.webhook-2: Webhooks to support the Live mode, Test mode and Test mode to Test mode, which can be in MaxPay console sending Test data receiving URL is normal;Live mode to production environment, the normal trading records will notify to the URL.
